article.headline: UTEP 75, Saint Mary's 62
article.story: ANAHEIM, Calif. -- Randy Culpepper had 20 points before fouling out and UTEP handed St. Mary's its first loss of the season Thursday with a 75-62 victory in the first round of the 76 Classic. The more athletic Miners built on their 40-27 halftime lead with a 10-0 run to open the second half for their largest advantage. St. Mary's responded by scoring 11 straight points to make it 50-38, but never threatened UTEP again. Gaels' center Omar Samhan had eight points during that run and led St. Mary's (3-1) with 20 points and 14 rebounds. Senior guard Stefon Jackson, UTEP's second all-time leading scorer, finished with 17 points and 10 rebounds. Arnett Moultrie added 15 points and Kareem Cooper had 12 points for UTEP (3-1). St. Mary's guard Patrick Mills, the West Coast Conference Newcomer of the Year last season, made just 5-of-20 field goals and missed all six 3-point attempts for 16 points. He made two free throws with 2:19 remaining to cap a 7-2 run to pull the Gaels as close as 68-60.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
